title: Work & Daily Routine
description: Learn vocabulary about jobs, workplaces, and daily activities.

words.meaning: a person you work with
words.example: My colleague helped me with the project.

words.meaning: a gathering of people to discuss something
words.example: We have a meeting at 10 o'clock.

words.meaning: the time by which something must be done
words.example: The deadline for the report is Friday.

words.meaning: money paid regularly for work
words.example: She receives her salary every month.

words.meaning: a plan of activities and times
words.example: My schedule is very busy this week.
words.exampleMeaning: 이번 주 내 일정이 아주 바빠요.

words.meaning: to stop sleeping
words.example: I wake up at 7 a.m. every day.

words.meaning: to travel regularly between home and work
words.example: I commute by subway every day.

words.meaning: extra time worked beyond normal hours
words.example: He often works overtime on Fridays.

words.meaning: a short rest period
words.example: Let's take a break for 10 minutes.

words.meaning: a person in charge of a team or department
words.example: The manager approved my vacation request.

words.meaning: a planned piece of work
words.example: We're starting a new project next month.

words.meaning: a regular series of actions
words.example: Exercise is part of my daily routine.

words.meaning: a scheduled meeting at a specific time
words.example: I have an appointment with the dentist.

words.meaning: to put on clothes
words.example: I get dressed after taking a shower.

words.meaning: a piece of work to be done
words.example: I finished all my tasks for today.

words.meaning: a place where people work
words.example: The office opens at 9 a.m.

words.meaning: a written account of something
words.example: I need to write a monthly report.

words.meaning: a period of work time
words.example: She works the night shift.

words.meaning: having a lot to do
words.example: I'm too busy to meet today.

words.meaning: to complete something
words.example: I finish work at 6 p.m.

words.meaning: to make ready
words.example: I prepare my lunch the night before.

words.meaning: a duty or job to do
words.example: It's my responsibility to train new staff.

words.meaning: a person or company that employs people
words.example: My employer offers good benefits.

words.meaning: a person who works for someone
words.example: The company has 50 employees.

words.meaning: moving to a higher position at work
words.example: She got a promotion last month.

words.meaning: to leave a job voluntarily
words.example: He decided to resign from his position.

words.meaning: to employ someone
words.example: The company will hire five new workers.
words.koreanCommonMistake: higher(더 높은)와 발음이 같으므로 문맥으로 구분

words.meaning: a formal meeting to assess someone for a job
words.example: I have a job interview tomorrow.

words.meaning: a document showing work history and skills
words.example: Please send your resume by email.

words.meaning: a section of an organization
words.example: She works in the marketing department.

words.meaning: a person who watches and directs work
words.example: My supervisor gave me feedback on my work.
words.exampleMeaning: 제 관리자가 제 업무에 대한 피드백을 주셨어요.
words.mnemonic: super(위에서) + visor(보는 사람) → 위에서 지켜보는 사람

words.meaning: time off from work for rest
words.example: I'm taking a vacation next week.

words.meaning: time off work due to illness
words.example: She's on sick leave this week.
words.koreanPronunciationTip: 식 리브 - 두 단어를 자연스럽게 연결

words.meaning: a large formal meeting
words.example: I'm attending a business conference.

words.meaning: a formal talk about a topic
words.example: I have to give a presentation tomorrow.

words.meaning: a written legal agreement
words.example: Please sign the employment contract.

words.meaning: extra advantages from a job
words.example: The job offers great benefits.

words.meaning: stopping work permanently, usually due to age
words.example: He's planning for retirement next year.

words.meaning: to give money for work or goods
words.example: The company pays well.
words.koreanCommonMistake: pay, paid, paid 불규칙 동사 주의

words.meaning: to receive money for work
words.example: She earns $50,000 a year.

words.meaning: to formally request something, especially a job
words.example: I want to apply for this job.
words.koreanCommonMistake: apply for (직업), apply to (학교) 전치사 구분
words.mnemonic: apply for a job = 직업에 지원하다

words.meaning: a skill or certificate needed for a job
words.example: Do you have the right qualifications?
words.koreanCommonMistake: 긴 단어이므로 천천히 발음 연습 필요

words.meaning: knowledge or skill from doing something
words.example: She has five years of work experience.

words.meaning: an ability to do something well
words.example: Communication is an important skill.

words.meaning: the process of learning skills
words.example: New employees receive training.

words.meaning: an area where someone works
words.example: Keep your workspace clean and organized.

words.meaning: a small separated work area in an office
words.example: Each employee has their own cubicle.
words.exampleMeaning: 각 직원은 자신의 칸막이 공간이 있어요.

words.meaning: written work and documents
words.example: I have a lot of paperwork to complete.
words.mnemonic: paper(종이) + work(일) → 종이 일 = 서류 작업

words.meaning: the act of being present at work or school
words.example: Good attendance is important for this job.

words.meaning: arriving or doing something at the expected time
words.example: Please be punctual for the meeting.
words.mnemonic: punct(점) + ual → 정확한 시점 = 시간 엄수

exercises.question: What does 'deadline' mean?
options: the time by which something must be done
exercises.answer: the time by which something must be done

pairs.meaning: a piece of work to do
